levels.description: No or insufficient coverage: The solution does not include a clear event scope, user stories, stakeholder list, or communication plan.

Partial coverage: The solution includes some components (e.g., event scope or partial user stories) but one or more required sections (user stories, stakeholder list, or communication plan) are missing or underdeveloped.
Complete coverage: The solution fully includes a detailed event scope, 5-6 well-articulated user stories, a comprehensive stakeholder list, and a clear, actionable communication plan.
No or insufficient breakdown: The solution lacks a clear breakdown into major tasks, sub-tasks, or fails to include a backlog.
Partial breakdown: The solution includes a breakdown into tasks and sub-tasks or a partial backlog, but does not fully identify 6 major tasks or provide sufficient sub-task details.
Complete breakdown: The solution clearly breaks the event into 6 major tasks with detailed sub-tasks and includes a well-prioritized backlog covering all specified elements.
No or insufficient schedule and plan: The solution does not include a Gantt chart/PDM for task dependencies or lacks a clear sprint planning document.
Partial schedule and plan: The solution includes either a basic event schedule or a sprint plan but does not fully detail task dependencies, deadlines, or assignment of tasks.

Complete schedule and plan: The solution provides a detailed Gantt chart or equivalent detailing task dependencies, along with a comprehensive sprint planning document that includes sprint tasks, assignments, and deadlines.
No or insufficient wrap-up: The solution does not address event wrap-up activities, key metric summaries, or the sprint retrospective report.

Partial wrap-up: The solution includes some details on event wrap-up or retrospective (e.g., summary of event metrics or incomplete retrospective analysis) but is missing complete information on all required aspects.

Complete wrap-up: The solution provides a detailed event wrap-up report with key metrics (attendance, budget, vendor payments, etc.) and a thorough sprint retrospective outlining successes, challenges, and areas for improvement.
Non-compliant: The solution fails to address the majority of the specified requirements.
Partially compliant: The solution addresses several requirements but omits significant elements or does not fully meet the specified criteria.
Fully compliant: The solution meets and addresses all specified requirements and deliverable formats exactly as defined.
Inaccurate or incomplete: The solution contains errors or lacks important details necessary for accurate interpretation.
Moderately accurate and complete: The solution contains some inaccuracies or omissions but generally includes most required details.
Highly accurate and complete: The solution is free of errors and provides comprehensive details for each required deliverable.
Unclear and disorganized: The solution lacks logical flow and structure, making it difficult to follow.
Somewhat clear and organized: The solution has a basic structure but may have issues with flow or clarity in some sections.
Clear and well-organized: The solution is logically structured, clear, and easy to navigate with distinct sections for each requirement.
Poor presentation: The deliverable does not adhere to the required format and lacks professional formatting.
Moderate presentation: The deliverable follows most formatting guidelines but lacks consistency or professional appearance.
Excellent presentation: The deliverable strictly adheres to the required format with clear, professional formatting and style.
Not submitted on time or in incorrect format: The deliverable is late or does not comply with the specified format.
Partially timely or format compliant: The deliverable is submitted on time but may have minor format deviations, or vice versa.
Fully timely and format compliant: The deliverable is submitted on time and exactly adheres to the specified document formats (docx, xlsx, png).
